p:
Buffelgrass is an invasive perennial grass native to Africa that has been introduced widely as a forage species and for erosion control
16 . Following its introduction, buffelgrass has spread and become invasive in many natural areas globally where it has various impacts on native ecosystems. Various species distribution models exist for buffelgrass, including global and regional models under current and future climate that provide information on its potential distribution
17– 19 . In the Sonoran Desert, conversion of native vegetation to buffelgrass savanna has altered ecohydrology
20 , altered fire regimes
21, 22 , and negatively impacted populations of native species
23– 25 . Altered fire regimes and impacts to native populations have also been observed in Australia
26– 28 .
